description.p: A Human finds a dragon egg in the wild, abandoned and left to its own devices. The egg is warm to the touch and seems to pulse with a faint inner light. It hatches and looks at the human. The human leaves it alone, but it follows him around. Eventually the human picks up the baby dragon and takes it with him on his adventures. The dragon grows with the human and they become partners, taking on everything together.
Modded Class from BG3, Made By: uilstar

description.p: At 1st level, you choose your dragon's type between a red dragon(fire), a blue dragon(lightning),or a white dragon(ice). This dragon will then grow with you as you gain levels.
Also at 1st level, you summon a dragon to be alongside you. This dragon is a companion that gains levels with you and can be commanded to attack enemies or defend you.

As a bonus action, you can summon your dragon companion up to 15ft from you. This is free once per short rest for full HP (any time) or -5 of your HP and brings dragon at Your Level*5 for health (out of combat only).

At 2nd level, you and your dragon share a fierce bond. When the character or dragon drops to 0 hit points, the one still up will have advantage on attacks against the creature that brought the character down to zero, and any attack against the alive character is at disadvantage. If the character or dragon attacks a creature that did not do the blow, the attack will be at disadvantage. If the character dies, the dragon will do x2 damage on all attacks and x4 on the one that dropped character to 0 HP, or the one the caused the characters death.

At 3rd level, you choose your Elemental Fighting Style of melee or ranged.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternitvy, you can choose a Feat instead.
At level 4 you learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

Maneuvers.
You learn one maneuvers of your choice, which are detailed under “Maneuvers” below. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack. You learn an additional maneuver of your choice at 9th, 13th, and 17th level. Each time you learn new maneuvers, you can also replace one maneuver you know with a different one.

Superiority Dice.
You have four superiority dice, which are d20s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest. You gain another superiority die at 9th level, 13th level, and 17th level.

Saving Throws.
Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver’s effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

center.p: Maneuver save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength.

Once per battle, using your Action and a Bonus action and a cost of 3 stacks of dragon power, you attack three times with your melee weapon. description.p: At 7th level, you can use your action, bonus action, and six stacks of dragon power, and create a powerful aura 5 feet in a radius around you. On use, causes you to gain the dash effect. This aura lasts for 2 turns. Anyone you consider an enemy inside this radius at any point (you move near them or they move near you) must make a Strength Saving Throw (8 + Strength + Proficiency), on pass, they take half damage, on fail, they take 4d6 dragon element damage for every turn your aura is up. If a enemy is affected by your aura, at the start of your next turn while your aura is still up, they will take antoher 4d6 dragon element damage. This ability upgrades in damage, cost, turns, and usage as you level up. When your aura goes down, you become lethargic for a turn.
